data_format: ASCII (3 columns): wavelength (µm), n, k (POSEIDON docs)
source_authors_year: Eckes et al. (2013) + POSEIDON directional refractive indices dataset
table_or_section: POSEIDON Opacity Database → Aerosol Database → Mg2SiO4 (Directional and Temperature Properties)
exact_location: POSEIDON opacity_database.html Mg2SiO4 entry: file list + axis labels + "It is defined that B1U = Ec, B2U = Eb, B3U = Ea (pers. comm)"; POSEIDON aerosol_database.html: refractive index txt file format. Local file: Mg2SiO4_295K_B1U.txt | Directionality_Table.pdf Table 1 (Mg2SiO4 entries; 2.5–30 µm) + Note (precomputed aerosol DB min/max 0.2–30 µm)
evidence_quote:
Mg2SiO4_295K_B1U (E ∥ c)
It is defined that B1U = Ec, B2U = Eb, B3U = Ea (pers. comm)
Refractive index txt files should be 3 columns in ASCII: first column wavelengths (um), second real indices, third imaginary indices.
Directionality_Table.pdf Table 1: Mg2SiO4 ... Synthetic (2.5,30); Note: absolute minimum and maximum of the precomputed aerosol database is 0.2 and 30 µm; B1U = E kc, B2U = E kb, B3U = E ka (pers comm.)
notes: POSEIDON docs lists Mg2SiO4 directional/temperature data as 2.5–30 µm; uploaded file spans 2.5–5117.5 µm (includes points >30 µm). POSEIDON docs also warns some wavelengths were extrapolated; provenance of >30 µm portion for this file is not documented in the docs → treat cautiously. Directionality_Table.pdf also lists Mg2SiO4 range as 2.5–30 µm and notes aerosol DB min/max 0.2–30 µm; >30 µm remains undocumented in that source.

wavelength_um_min: UNKNOWN (paper uses IR range; see text/figs)
data_format: Tables of Lorentz-oscillator fit parameters (dielectric function), not explicit n,k tables
file_url: UNKNOWN (paper does not clearly provide machine-readable n,k in PDF text extraction)
evidence_quote: UNKNOWN | determined to be Mg 1.72Fe0.2SiO 4 | Table 1 Comparison of the Fit Parameters from the Lorentz
notes: 純Mg2SiO4ではない。n,kはモデル（誘電関数）から導出される形で、n,k数表としての直接提供は未確認。
この手元PDF群と現時点の確認範囲では、溶融フォルステライトの実測 n,k 数表を確定できていない。
